subdialogue_text: Ahh, you're no jailer, are you?
No, no, you're from far away. And judging by the bell...
You must be some of that unkindled ash.

Remarkable.
If that's true, then I have a favour to ask.
Below the High Wall is a musty little town.
Not the home of any lord, just a very old settlement of Undead.
An old woman, Loretta, lives there.
Please give her this ring.
I-I'm not asking for charity. In fa- in fact, if you do this for me...
I'll be sure to repay you in kind.
I-I may be a petty thief, but I've more wits than most royalty.
What do you say, then?
Yes, well, why should you?
But if you change your mind, give me a shout, eh?
I-I'm only a petty thief. I've nowhere else to go.
Not like there's anything calling to me out there...

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Refuse" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Oh, what have we here? Changed your mind, perhaps?

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Refuse" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: You deliver the ring, and I offer my co-operation.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Refuse" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Hardly a shabby deal, hm?

behavior: #0Choose "Grant request" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Very well. I humbly place my faith in you.

behavior: #0Choose "Grant request" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text:
I am Greirat of the Undead Settlement,
and I promise to assist you.

behavior: #0Choose "Grant request" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text:
Give this ring to old Loretta
at the base of the High Wall.

behavior: #0Choose "Grant request" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: ...Do your part, and I'll do mine.
What in buggery!
Damn it, you've lost it, haven't you!
Cold piss, what the devil is it now!
I get caught once, and now this!
One bloody time! Curse the gods!
As they say,
"The cornered rat will lick the balls of a cat."
Forgive me, dear...
Oh, hello, you're back.
And in one piece. Well, now it's time I do my part.
Whatever trinket you need, speak up.
Just don't ask me where I got them.
Oh, hello, you're back.
And in one piece. Well, now it's time I do my part.
Do me a favour, and don't forget our promise.

Give the ring to old Loretta
at the base of the High Wall.
A nuisance, I know, but it'll help me tie up some loose ends.
Heavens, she was already dead...
Thank you. I-I'm not surprised, though.
Hmm, almost a relief, really.
You can keep the ring.
As, well, a little trinket of thanks, I suppose.
You can keep the ring.
As, well, a little trinket of thanks, I suppose.

behavior: #0Talk-1st time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Heavens, she was already dead...

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Ahh, there you are. I was thinking...

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: You know I'm a petty thief.

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Well, perhaps I'll go on the prowl.

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text:
Everyone's dead or hollowed away anyway,
right, so...

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text:
I might as well fetch
some weapons or treasure for you.

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after giving him Loretta's Bone & travels from Firelink Shrine
subdialogue_text: Well, what do you say?
All right, fine and well.
If that's your wish, I can only obey.
But, feel free to change your mind later.
I wouldn't want to lose my touch...
What is it? Have you changed your mind?

I'm ready to go thieving at a moment's notice.
Just give me the word.

behavior: #0Choose "Send him to pillage" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Thank you. You will not be disappointed.

behavior: #0Choose "Send him to pillage" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Greirat the Thief was once a well-known name.

behavior: #0Choose "Send him to pillage" to either the 1st or 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Until I ended up rotting in a cell...

behavior: #0Choose "Send him to pillage" to either the 1st or 2nd query

subdialogue_text: Greirat the Thief was once a well-known name.
Until I ended up rotting in a cell...

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving
subdialogue_text: Oh, hello, you've come at a good time.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving
subdialogue_text: It took some prowling, but I've finally made a score.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving
subdialogue_text: Go on, have a gander.

behavior: #0Talk-After protagonist has reached Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: Ahh, hello, fine work, I say.

behavior: #0Talk-After protagonist has reached Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: Discovering Irithyll in the Boreal Valley, all in a day's work.

behavior: #0Talk-After protagonist has reached Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text:
If the tales are true, it is home to old moon-worshipping nobles,
and should be packed with treasure.

behavior: #0Talk-After protagonist has reached Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: What do you think? Shall I go and see what I can find?

behavior: #0Choose "Refuse"  to pillage Irithyll, either the 1st or 2nd query prompted
subdialogue_text: If that is your wish, I can only obey.

behavior: #0Choose "Refuse"  to pillage Irithyll, either the 1st or 2nd query prompted
subdialogue_text: But, feel free to change your mind later.

behavior: #0Choose "Refuse"  to pillage Irithyll, either the 1st or 2nd query prompted
subdialogue_text: I hate to leave a city of nobles ripe for the picking...

behavior: #0Choose "Refuse"  to pillage Irithyll, either the 1st or 2nd query prompted

subdialogue_text: What is it? Changed your mind?

I'm ready to go thieving at a moment's notice.

subdialogue_text: Mm, a fine choice!

subdialogue_text: Oh, then, we are both safe and sound.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving in Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: Thank the gods for that. I don't like cutting things so close.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving in Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: I might've died if it wasn't for that peculiar onion knight.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving in Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: But in the end, it all paid off.

behavior: #0Talk-After he has made it back from thieving in Irithyll of the Boreal Valley
subdialogue_text: Take a good look. They're sure to be of some use.
You know, I was thinking...
About leaving for another round of thieving.

There must be something of use
in Lothric Castle.
I-I'm aware of the danger. That castle is a deathtrap.

Not a single man has returned from the castle unscathed,
even back in the day.
But I don't want sit around and die a petty rat.
And I consider myself your friend.
Right, fine. You're very thoughtful, you are.
But, if you change your mind, do speak up.
I meant every word of what I said.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Refuse"  to pillage Lothric Castlel
subdialogue_text: Changed your mind?

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Refuse"  to pillage Lothric Castlel
subdialogue_text:
I hope you do.
I lived a petty rat, but would rather not die as one.
Thank you, for placing your trust in me.

Oh, don't you worry.
I know Lothric like the back of my hand.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Send him to pillage" Lothric Castle
subdialogue_text:
Oh, don't you worry.
I know Lothric like the back of my hand.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Talk" after choosing "Send him to pillage" Lothric Castle

subdialogue_text: Goodbye, and stay safe.

Oh, this place is a bore.
What good is thievery if you've nowhere to go?

subdialogue_text: Good-bye. I will leave for some time. So long for now.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Leave" or after leaving abruptly, after "Send him to pillage"
subdialogue_text: Do stay safe, you hear? Or my efforts will have been for naught.

behavior: #0Menu-Choose "Leave" or after leaving abruptly, after "Send him to pillage"

subdialogue_text: You're headed for the brink, aren't you?
Well, you won't drag me down.
En guarde, you crusty ash bastard!
Cold piss, why did it come to this...
I've gone and run my course, haven't I?
##Curses, how did this...
##I might've died if it wasn't for that little knight Anri.
##What's got into you?
##Stop that, please, stop!
##How could you!
##And I thought we were friends...some friends...
